llm.feedback: Strong core ideas exist, but to reach world‑class quality they must be rewritten as a 4–6 sentence executive brief with a single, decision‑ready house view. Actionable edits: (1) crystallize a linear causal chain from micro anchors (15% savings; Chanel‑quality purchases) to steadier credit demand and selective durable‑goods investment, then to asset prices, tying each step to specific sources (1GVYF2V8O/2QRLB974F; NL5YYTLF2; 22PL3Q360/W2622L6WW). (2) Ground the base case in first principles and quantify: AI productivity lift ~1–1.5% of trend GDP (UPV3X2MQ6) and the EV cycle’s profitability risk (22PL3Q360; W2622L6WW), with explicit ranges where cited. (3) Present 3–4 explicit catalysts/triggers with thresholds and clear invalidation points (e.g., yield moves of 50–75 bp in 3 months; EPJYXB7DX; 218AGGUXB; NL5YYTLF2), plus a concise 0–3 week playbook. (4) Reconcile conflicts and constrain scope by linking the Brookings/UBI automation debate to a policy premia thesis (NL5YYTLF2) and noting Finland’s UBI result as a non‑employment boost signal, not a macro certainty.
